explanation: Funds are required to be returned to the original appropriation where appropriated in Title III of division B of the CARES Act due to unrealized costs in the Research, Development, Test, and Evaluation,,

Funds are available for transfer after a comprehensive review of the Department of Defense |{requirements to prevent, prepare for, and respond to the coronavirus. During the review, $68.55 million was identified as excess to need and available for transfer to higher department priorities. This is CARES Act

Funds are required for the following efforts: | ‘& $+10.753 million for FY 2020 Non Appropriated Fund (NAF) pandemic-related expenses, including avoidance of reduced work hours for or furlough of NAF personnel. Non-appropriated fund activities are experiencing cash shortages as a result of various activities closing or reducing hours and operations due to COVID-19. In addition to qualifying personnel expenses, funds are required for personal protective equipment and enhanced cleaning supplies/disinfectants for NAF activities. This | is a CARES Act division B, Title II, requirement. - | $+36.722 million to support the Army’s Child, Youth and School Services (CYS) programs during the COVID-19 pandemic. Additional resources will support: 1) Information Technology requirements to expand and enhance the virtual learning environment capability; 2) transportation of the children from and to School Age Care and Youth Centers; 3) Army Fee Assistance subsidy program to address increased demand for off-post programs; 4) additional fixtures and protective partitions to allow more social distancing and protection at the School Age Care and Youth Center facilities. This is a CARES Act division B, Title III, requirement.
